alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 11:05AM CDT until May 12 at 9:51PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding along the Lavaca River reaches hundreds of yards into the lower floodplain backing up sloughs and low areas. Minor roads and near the river flood and livestock are isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 23.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.3 feet on 05/21/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Lavaca River Edna 21.0 15.8 Wed 10 am CD 22.8 20.0 11.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM CDT.
